summary: NBIC used information from various sources to communicate pertinent information on the emergence of PEDV in the united states. PEDV subsequently spread rapidly among the domestic swine herds throughout the united states. as of august 20, 2014, PEDV had been detected in 30 U.S. states affecting more than seven million pigs. swine industry and pork prices are still suffering an impact due to PEDV. six countries have imposed import restriction on pigs and pork products. at least two of those countries, china and japan, have since lifted their restrictions. events such as the emergence of PEDV present opportunities for collaboration with federal partners.
